channel.title: How can i make a client?
channel.description: I want to make my own client...But i don't know how to start(lol) i think i need a deob (i have mopars auto deober thing)...i get a deob thing called runescape...but i don't know what to do with it..my client. i want to rune private servers..something like moparscape only i want to make it so i can call it my own(wow, that sounds gay...lol) well, anyone that could help(tell me what i should start learning to do all this) i would be very appreciated. I do know a little java..

item.title: How can i make a client?
item.dc:creator: @Takajin Takajin++
item.description:
@Takajin wrote:

Now I get

Now compiling java files... client.java:7395: ')' expected return new URL("http://"+68.238.218.235+":"+(80 + anInt958)); ^ 1 error Done! Now Jar'ing class files... Done! Press any key to continue . . .

When compiling…

EDIT: Nevermind I fixed it.

It has to have those + signs or it screws up Wink

item.source: How can i make a client?

item.title: How can i make a client?
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:9, topic:4884”]You don’t need a password for private servers (unless you want one and program it in ;)).

To make a client login to a specific server, just search for
Code:

public final URL getCodeBase()

And change:
Code:

            return new URL("http://"+aString1174+":" + (80 + anInt958));

To:

Code:

            return new URL("http://"serverip":" + (80 + anInt958));[/quote]

You mean return new URL(“http://” + serverip + “:” + (80 + anInt958));

It has to have those + signs or it screws up

Read full topic

item.title: How can i make a client?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

You don’t need a password for private servers (unless you want one and program it in ;)).

To make a client login to a specific server, just search for
Code:

public final URL getCodeBase()

And change:
Code:

            return new URL("http://"+aString1174+":" + (80 + anInt958));

To:

Code:

            return new URL("http://"serverip":" + (80 + anInt958));

Read full topic

how do you make it so the client only acesses your server so all you have to do is put in your user/pass??

Read full topic
item.source: How can i make a client?

item.title: How can i make a client?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Yeah, you can put whatever you want in the username thing, and don’t put anything in the server thing, just make sure the server is running on your computer.

So to sum it up:
Runserver.bat
Run.bat
Enter “Evil_” for username
Put nothing in “Server”
Accept…

You are now on your own private server.

Read full topic

item.title: How can i make a client?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Comment out 599, 600, and 601.

Or you can just run the server without compiling as the .class files are there too.
